com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Interface Tool

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AirbrushTool, ArrowTool, BasicTool, BoundsTool, CurveTool, EraserTool, FillTool, FreeformShapeTool, LassoTool, LinearTool, LineTool, MagnifierTool, MarqueeTool, OvalTool, PaintbrushTool, PathTool, PencilTool, PerspectiveTool, PolygonTool, PolylineTool, ProjectionTool, RectangleTool, RotateTool, RoundRectangleTool, RubberSheetTool, ScaleTool, SelectionTool, ShapeTool, SlantTool, StrokedCursorPathTool, TextTool, TransformTool

    public interface Tool

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate(PaintCanvas canvas)
      Activates this tool on a given canvas.
      void deactivate()
      Deactivates the tool on the canvas.
      ToolAttributes getAttributes()
      Gets the set of tool attributes bound to this tool (like paint color, fill mode, line size, etc.)
      PaintCanvas getCanvas()
      Gets the canvas on which this tool is currently painting, or null, if the tool has not been activated (via a call to activate(PaintCanvas)).
      PaintToolType getPaintToolType()
      Gets the type of this tool.
      Scratch getScratch()
      Gets the scratch buffer of the canvas that this tool is presently activated on, applying this tool's anti- aliasing mode to the scratch buffer's graphics context.
      Cursor getToolCursor()
      Gets the default mouse cursor used when painting with this tool.
      boolean isActive()
      Determines if this tool is presently active on a canvas.
      void setToolCursor(Cursor toolCursor)
      Sets the default mouse cursor used when painting with this tool.

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        void activate(PaintCanvas canvas)
        Activates this tool on a given canvas.

        A paint tool does not "paint" on the canvas until it is activated. Typically, only one tool is active on a canvas at any given time, but there is no technical limitation preventing multiple tools from being active at once. While a canvas may have multiple active tools drawing on it, a tool can only be active on a single canvas.

        Use deactivate() to stop this tool from painting on the canvas.

        Parameters:
        canvas - The paint canvas on which to activate the tool.

      • deactivate

        void deactivate()
        Deactivates the tool on the canvas. Invoking this method on a tool this is not presently activated has no effect. A deactivated tool no longer affects the canvas and all listeners / observers are un-subscribed making the tool available for garbage collection.

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Determines if this tool is presently active on a canvas. A tool is considered active after a call to activate(PaintCanvas) has been made, but before a call to deactivate().
        Returns:
        True if the tool is active, false otherwise.

      • getToolCursor

        Cursor getToolCursor()
        Gets the default mouse cursor used when painting with this tool. Note that specific tools may provide methods for getting and setting auxiliary cursors that are active during tool-specific states, too.
        Returns:
        The default tool cursor.

      • setToolCursor

        void setToolCursor(Cursor toolCursor)
        Sets the default mouse cursor used when painting with this tool.
        Parameters:
        toolCursor - The default mouse cursor.

      • getCanvas

        PaintCanvas getCanvas()
        Gets the canvas on which this tool is currently painting, or null, if the tool has not been activated (via a call to activate(PaintCanvas)).
        Returns:
        The canvas this tool is painting on, or null

      • getScratch

        Scratch getScratch()
        Gets the scratch buffer of the canvas that this tool is presently activated on, applying this tool's anti- aliasing mode to the scratch buffer's graphics context.
        Returns:
        The active scratch buffer.

      • getPaintToolType

        PaintToolType getPaintToolType()
        Gets the type of this tool.
        Returns:
        The tool type.

      • getAttributes

        ToolAttributes getAttributes()
        Gets the set of tool attributes bound to this tool (like paint color, fill mode, line size, etc.)
        Returns:
        The set of observable tool attributes.
